page.title: 01AUCHTERMUCHTY..GAZETTEER
page.content: Our D_Block is in{N.E. Fife},east of Auchtermuchty (56 degrees 18 minutes N 3 degrees 15 minutes W).A settlement of approximately 2000 people , Auchtermuchty lies at the foot of the Ochil Hills ,on the flat floor of the Howe of Fife .It has the unusual feature in Eastern Scotland of thatched roofs on some of its houses. To the N.E. of Auchtermuchty lies Weddersbie Hill (156m), the top of which has been planted by the forestry commission with coniferous trees . Arable farming is the main land use both on the hillsides and on the flat valley floor. There is a scattered rural community with farm buildings, housing farmers ,their families and the farm workers.A few basalt rock outcrops,which were once quarried,can be seen.
